description.default:
Sends commands to [[X10]] Home Automation devices. Can also generate events based on X10 events. Tested with CM15A USB transceiver. Other transceivers may also work.
Requires installation of the ActiveHome Pro SDK: http://voxcommando.com/files/ahsdk_install.exe

info.parameter: Type of command to send, example: SendPlc
Command string. See description for examples

description.default:
The X10.SendAny action allows you to specify any <Type> of <Command> to send in case you wish to use a command other than SendPlc, SendRf, or QueryPlc. Some other command types that *might* work (with the correct command) are: SendSecureRf, SendSecureHomeControlRf, SendIr
Example: <Type> SendSecureRf <Command> homearmdelayed standard 100

info.parameter: Command string. See description for examples

description.default:
Sends the PLC (Power line command) <Command> to the X10 interface.
Example command strings:
A1 ON B3 DIM 20 A5 BRIGHT 40 C1 ALLUNITSOFF

info.parameter: Command string. See description for examples

description.default:
Sends the RF (Radio Frequency) <Command> to the X10 interface.
Example command strings:
A1 ON B3 DIM 20 A5 BRIGHT 40 C1 ALLUNITSOFF

Ask the X10 service the status of any address. There are two kinds of status to check: - On status: <X10 address> on - Dim level: <X10 address> dim Specifying the "on" parameter returns 0 if off, 1 if on. Dim returns the dim level as a percentage of full brightness.. Both functions return -1 if the current status is not known.
Example to check if A1 is on [0] or off [1]: A1 ON
